证据片段: In zirconium and Zircaloy, the development of the strong deformation texture is caused by the complicated interaction between slip and twinning.

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: For metals or alloys with a below-normal c/a ratio (c/a < 1.633), as for example zirconium, titanium, and hafnium, the position of the basal poles is tilted by ±30 to 50 deg from the normal direction toward the transverse direction.

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: Experiments following the texture development in polycrystalline material, including also lower degrees of deformation, are described in Ref 16. The activated deformation systems had been followed in detail after various sequential rolling steps in the individual grains of a polycrystal with an almost random orientation.

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: The results show that in a coarse-grained polycrystal the criterion of compatibility by von Mises [17] is fulfilled; that is, in each individual grain at least five mutually independent deformation systems are activated.

证据片段: The effect of slip on the lattice rotation is shown in Fig. 1. As the slip traces show, threefold slip of the main slip system on prism planes in the a-direction does occur.

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_004_chunk2
证据片段: Simultaneously with slip, twinning is activated even at low degrees of deformation, for example, 0.5 percent (see Fig. 2).
